ns0:Resource.title: 6dF Galaxy Survey Data Release 2

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: 6dF survey galaxy galaxies redshift redshifts 2MASS
content.description: The 6dF Galaxy Survey (6dFGS) aims to measure the redshifts of around 150 000 galaxies, and the peculiar velocities of a 15 000-member subsample, over almost the entire southern sky. The table called Spectra contains the redshifts and qualities of all the observations. When complete, it will be the largest redshift survey of the nearby Universe, reaching out to about z ~ 0.15, and more than an order of magnitude larger than any peculiar velocity survey to date. The targets are all galaxies brighter than K tot = 12.75 in the 2MASS Extended Source Catalog (XSC), supplemented by 2MASS and SuperCOSMOS galaxies that complete the sample to limits of (H, J , r F, bJ) = (13.05, 13.75, 15.6, 16.75).

capability.description: twomass table: cone search for K, J and H selected samples originating from the 2MASS XSC
denisj table: cone search for sources from the DENIS survey with J less than 13.85
agn2mass table: cone search for candidate AGN from 2MASS red AGN survey
denisi table: cone search for sources from the DENIS survey with I less than 14.85
nvss table: cone search for candidate QSOs from NVSS
supercos table: cone search for galaxies selected from SuperCOSMOS scans of UKST plates
rass table: cone search for candidate QSO/AGN from the ROSAT All-Sky Survey
hipass table: cone search for candidate galaxies from the HIPASS survey in HI
shapley table: cone search for galaxies from the Shapely supercluster region
spectra table: cone search for observational and redshift related data
hes table: cone search for candidate QSOs from the Hamburg/ESO Survey
sumss table: cone search for bright radio sources from SUMSS
fsc table: cone search for galaxies from the IRAS faint source catalogue
durukst table: cone search for galaxies from the extension to the Durham/UKST galaxy survey
target table: cone search for master target list used to configure 6dFGS observations
Access to two applications: general ADQL query, and asynchronous cone-search where relevant/enabled.

table.name: twomass
table.description: The TWOMASS table contains holds the K, J and H selected samples originating from the 2MASS extended source catalogue

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

column.name: J_M_K20FE
column.description: J 20mag/sq." isophotal fiducial ell. ap. magnitude

column.name: H_M_K20FE
column.description: H 20mag/sq." isophotal fiducial ell. ap. magnitude

column.name: K_M_K20FE
column.description: K 20mag/sq." isophotal fiducial ell. ap. magnitude

column.name: RADIUS
column.description: 20mag/sq." isophotal K fiducial ell. ap. semi-major axis

column.name: A_B
column.description: minor/major axis ratio fit to 3-sig. super-coadd isophote

column.name: MUK20FE
column.description: average surface brightness within the mu_K = 20mag/sq arcsec elliptical isophote (derived from K_M_K20FE, RADIUS and A_B)

column.name: CORR
column.description: correction, based on MUK20FE, made to the isophotal magnitude K_M_K20FE to get a pseudo-total magnitude K

column.name: J
column.description: J magnitude (JEXT) used for J selection

column.name: H
column.description: H magnitude (HEXT) used for H selection

column.name: K
column.description: K magnitude (corrected) used for K selection

table.name: denisj
table.description: The DENISJ table contains sources from the DENIS survey with J < 13.85

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: agn2mass
table.description: The AGN2MASS table contains candidate AGN from 2MASS red AGN survey

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: denisi
table.description: The DENISI table contains sources from the DENIS survey with I < 14.85

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: nvss
table.description: The NVSS table contains candidate QSOs from NVSS

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: supercos
table.description: The SUPERCOS table contains galaxies selected from SuperCOSMOS scans of UKST plates

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

column.name: MAG_1
column.description: Bj mag, SuperCOSMOS magnitudes generated from a revised calibration , done at the time of input catalogue preparation, tuned to the mag range of interest.

column.name: MAG_2
column.description: R mag, SuperCOSMOS magnitudes generated from a revised calibration, done at the time of input catalogue preparation, tuned to the mag range of interest.

table.name: rass
table.description: The RASS table contains candidate QSO/AGN from the ROSAT All-Sky Survey

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: hipass
table.description: The HIPASS table contains candidate galaxies from the HIPASS survey in HI

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: shapley
table.description: The SHAPLEY table contains galaxies from the Shapely supercluster region

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: spectra
table.description: The SPECTRA table holds all the observational and redshift related data

column.name: SPECID
column.description: unique ID no., used to generate GIF image of spectrum

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in <em>target</em> table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

column.name: HTMID
column.description: Hierarchical Triangular Mesh (20-deep), mainly useful internally for indexing on position

column.name: CX
column.description: Cartesian x of unit vector on celestial sphere

column.name: CY
column.description: Cartesian y of unit vector on celestial sphere

column.name: CZ
column.description: Cartesian z of unit vector on celestial sphere

column.name: Z_ORIGIN
column.description: redshift from C=combined V or R frame

column.name: ZEMIBESTERR
column.description: error on the selected emission line redshift, 0.0 if not measured

column.name: ZABSBESTERR
column.description: error on the selected absorption line redshift, 0.0 if not measured

column.name: ZFINALERR
column.description: error on final quoted redshift, 0.0 if not measured

column.name: ACTMJD_V
column.description: the time the field was actually configured

column.name: CONMJD_V
column.description: time which was specified when configure was run

column.name: EXP_V
column.description: V reference frame exposure time seconds

column.name: UTSTRT_V
column.description: UT start time of V reference frame

column.name: NAME_V
column.description: name of object in V frame

column.name: X_V
column.description: x position of object from V frame

column.name: Y_V
column.description: y position of object from V frame

column.name: PID_V
column.description: PID number read from V frame

column.name: ACTMJD_R
column.description: the time the field was actually configured

column.name: CONMJD_R
column.description: time which was specified when configure was run

column.name: EXP_R
column.description: R reference frame exposure time seconds

column.name: UTSTRT_R
column.description: UT start time of R reference frame

column.name: NAME_R
column.description: name of object in R frame

column.name: X_R
column.description: x position of object from R frame

column.name: Y_R
column.description: y position of object from R frame

column.name: PID_R
column.description: PID number read from R frame

table.name: hes
table.description: The HES table contains candidate QSOs from the Hamburg/ESO Survey

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: sumss
table.description: The SUMSS table contains bright radio sources from SUMSS

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: fsc
table.description: The FSC table contains galaxies from the IRAS faint source catalogue

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: durukst
table.description: The DURUKST table contains galaxies from the extension to the Durham/UKST galaxy survey

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: matching name in target table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

table.name: target
table.description: The TARGET table represents the master target list used to configure 6dFGS observations

column.name: TARGETID
column.description: unique ID no., used to link tables

column.name: TARGETNAME
column.description: name in config file, used to name FITS file and generate thumbnail images

column.name: HTMID
column.description: Hierarchical Triangular Mesh (20-deep) number, mainly useful internally for indexing on position

column.name: CX
column.description: Cartesian x of unit (ra,dec) vector on celestial sphere

column.name: CY
column.description: Cartesian y of unit (ra,dec) vector on celestial sphere

column.name: CZ
column.description: Cartesian z of unit (ra,dec) vector on celestial sphere

column.name: BMAG
column.description: Bj galaxy magnitude from recalibrated SuperCOSMOS data (0.00 is null)

column.name: RMAG
column.description: Rf galaxy magnitude from recalibrated SuperCOSMOS data (0.00 is null)

column.name: BMAGSEL
column.description: Bj magnitude from online SuperCOSMOS Sky Surveys (99.99 and 23.0 are nulls), appeared as BMAG in the EDR and DR1

column.name: RMAGSEL
column.description: Rf magnitude from online SuperCOSMOS Sky Surveys (99.99 and 22.0 are nulls), appeared as BMAG in the EDR and DR1
